As I stood there, I noticed a small, unassuming door in the wall of the garden, partially hidden by a tangle of overgrown bushes. It looked as though it hadn't been used in years, but something about it caught my eye, and I felt an inexplicable urge to investigate further. I asked one of the ostlers about the door, and he looked at me with a mixture of curiosity and wariness. "What's that door for?" I asked him, nodding towards the door. He hesitated, then leaned in close and whispered, "Some say it leads to a secret garden, but I don't know if that's true. Some folks say it's been locked up for years, but I've seen a light flickering in there at night, when the moon is full." He glanced around nervously, as if he feared being overheard. "But be careful, mate, if you go poking around in there, you might stir up more trouble than you bargained for." I thanked him for the warning, and he nodded in response, before turning back to his work. I stood there for a moment, weighing my options, and wondering if I should investigate further. The door seemed to be calling to me, and I couldn't shake the feeling that there was something important hidden behind it. I took a deep breath, and made up my mind to explore the mysterious door, and see where it would lead me. As I approached the door, I noticed that it was slightly ajar, as if someone or something had recently passed through it. I pushed it open slowly, and stepped inside, finding myself in a narrow, winding path, overgrown with weeds and vines. The air was thick with the scent of blooming flowers, and the sound of birdsong filled the air. I walked cautiously down the path, my heart pounding in my chest, and my senses on high alert. As I walked, the path began to narrow, and the trees grew taller, casting dappled shadows on the ground. I felt a sense of unease creeping over me, but I pressed on, determined to uncover the secrets that lay within. The path opened up into a small clearing, and in the center of it stood an enormous tree, its branches twisted and gnarled with age. I approached the tree, feeling a sense of awe and wonder. As I reached out to touch its trunk, I heard a faint rustling in the underbrush, and suddenly, a figure emerged from the shadows. It was a woman, dressed in a long, flowing gown, her hair wild and unkempt, and her eyes gleaming with a fierce intensity. She regarded me with a piercing gaze, and I felt a shiver run down my spine. "Who are you?" I asked her, trying to keep my voice steady. She didn't respond, but instead, she reached out and took my hand, her touch sending a jolt of electricity through my body. I felt a strange sense of connection to her, as if we were bound together by some unseen thread. She led me deeper into the clearing, the trees growing taller and the air thickening with an otherworldly energy. I felt myself being drawn into a world beyond my own, a world of magic and wonder. es_results_raw: para que beber, y un trozo de pan duro. Me senté en un banco de piedra que había en la esquina de la callejuela, y comencé a beber la cerveza, saboreando el sabor amargo. Mientras tanto, observé a los mozos de cuadra, que estaban charlando y riendo entre sí, mientras sus caballos pacían tranquilamente en el suelo. De repente, uno de ellos me llamó la atención, un caballo negro con una mancha blanca en la frente, que parecía muy tranquilo y relajado. Me pregunté qué historia podría tener detrás de esa tranquilidad, y si había sido siempre así de tranquilo o si había tenido algún tipo de experiencia traumática en su vida. Me puse a pensar en eso mientras seguía bebiendo mi cerveza, y de repente, se me ocurrió una idea. ¿Qué si yo fuera ese caballo, qué tipo de vida habría tenido? ¿Sería un caballo de carreras, un caballo de carga, o simplemente un caballo de pueblo, que pasaba sus días paciendo en un jardín tranquilo? Me puse a imaginar la vida de ese caballo, y cómo habría sido diferente si hubiera sido yo el que lo montara en lugar de los mozos de cuadra. Me sentí un poco triste al pensar en eso, pero también me sentí agradecido por la oportunidad de imaginar una vida diferente, y por la tranquilidad que me había encontrado en ese banco de piedra, rodeado de la vida y la naturaleza.

en_second_half: I jumped in before he could object. ‘The Church of St. Monica,’ said I, ‘and half a sovereign if you reach it in twenty minutes.’ It was twenty-five minutes to twelve, and of course it was clear enough what was in the wind.
en_results: output>The driver looked twice at such a shabby fare, but I was determined to get a ride, so I hastily jumped in and grabbed the door handle, just as the cab was about to drive off. The driver, a gruff-looking man with a thick
en_results_raw: <output>The driver looked twice at such a shabby fare, but I was determined to get a ride, so I hastily jumped in and grabbed the door handle, just as the cab was about to drive off. The driver, a gruff-looking man with a thick beard, eyed me suspiciously in the rearview mirror, but I managed to convince him that I was a paying customer by rummaging through my pockets and producing a handful of coins. He grunted and continued driving, taking me further into the city. As we navigated through the crowded streets, I couldn't help but think about the mysterious woman and the strange encounter we had just had. I was determined to learn more about her and the peculiar circumstances surrounding our meeting. The cab driver, seemingly oblivious to my thoughts, continued to drive in silence, his eyes fixed on the road ahead. I decided to strike up a conversation with him, hoping to gather more information about the area and perhaps even learn something about the woman. "Excuse me, driver," I said, "where are we headed?" The driver looked at me in the rearview mirror, his expression unreadable. "Depends on where you want to go, mate," he replied gruffly. I thought for a moment, trying to decide on a destination. "Take me to the nearest café," I said finally. The driver nodded and continued driving, taking me to a small, unassuming café on the outskirts of town. As we pulled up to the curb, I thanked the driver and handed him a few coins as payment. He took them gruffly and drove off, leaving me to enter the café. I pushed open the door and stepped inside, my eyes adjusting to the dim light within. The café was small, with only a handful of patrons scattered about. I spotted a figure sitting in the corner, a woman with long, curly hair and a kind smile. She looked up and caught my eye, and I felt a jolt of recognition. It was the woman from the street, the one who had dropped the package and run off. I felt a surge of excitement and curiosity, and I quickly made my way over to her table. "Mind if I join you?" I asked, trying to sound nonchalant. The woman looked up at me, a hint of surprise in her eyes. "Not at all," she said, smiling. I sat down across from her, trying to compose myself. "I'm afraid I'm a bit of a stranger in this city," I said, trying to break the ice. "I'm Sherlock Holmes, by the way." The woman's eyes widened in surprise, and she looked at me with a mixture of curiosity and wariness. "I'm afraid I don't know you, Mr. Holmes," she said, her voice firm but polite. I smiled, trying to put her at ease. "I'm a detective, of sorts," I explained. "I'm here to help people in need, and I couldn't help but notice that you seemed to be in a bit of a hurry earlier. Are you in some kind of trouble?" The woman's expression changed, and for a moment, I saw a glimmer of fear in her eyes. She looked around the café, as if checking to see if anyone was listening. "I'm afraid I am in a bit of a predicament," she said, her voice barely above a whisper. "I'm being followed, Mr. Holmes. I think someone is watching me." I felt a surge of adrenaline at her words, and I leaned in closer, my eyes locked on hers. "Tell me more," I said, my voice low and urgent. The woman glanced around the café again, her eyes darting back and forth. "I've been noticing strange things lately," she said, her voice trembling slightly. "People watching me, following me. I've tried to lose them, but they always seem to find me. I'm starting to feel like I'm being stalked." I nodded, my mind racing with possibilities. "I see," I said, trying to sound calm. "Can you tell me more about these people? What do they look like?" The woman hesitated, as if unsure of how much to reveal. "They're tall, with dark hair and sunglasses," she said finally. "They always wear a black suit and a hat. They seem to be trying to blend in, but I can always spot them." I nodded, my eyes scanning the café. "I think I see what you mean," I said, trying to sound reassuring. "Don't worry, I'll do my best to help you. But first, can you tell me more about this package you dropped earlier? What was it, and who was it from?" The woman's eyes widened in surprise, and she looked at me with a mixture of fear and gratitude.

en_first_half: Holmes had sat up upon the couch, and I saw him motion like a man who is in need of air. A maid rushed across and threw open the window. At the same instant I saw him raise his hand and at the signal I tossed my rocket into the room with a cry of “Fire!” The word was no sooner out of my mouth than the whole crowd of spectators, well dressed and ill—gentlemen, ostlers, and servant maids—joined in a general shriek of “Fire!” Thick clouds of smoke curled through the room
en_second_half: and out at the open window. I caught a glimpse of rushing figures, and a moment later the voice of Holmes from within assuring them that it was a false alarm. Slipping through the shouting crowd I made my way to the corner of the street, and in ten minutes was rejoiced to find my friend’s arm in mine, and to get away from the scene of uproar. He walked swiftly and in silence for some few minutes until we had turned down one of the quiet streets which lead towards the Edgeware Road.

es_first_half: Holmes se había sentado en el sofá y le vi moverse como un hombre que necesita respirar. Una criada se apresuró a abrir la ventana. En el mismo instante le vi levantar la mano y a la señal lancé mi cohete a la habitación con un grito de "¡Fuego!". La palabra no había salido de mi boca cuando toda la multitud de espectadores, tanto los bien vestidos como los mal vestidos, caballeros, posaderos y sirvientas, se unieron en un grito general de "¡Fuego!". Gruesas nubes de humo se extendieron por la habitación
es_second_half: y salieron por la ventana abierta. Alcancé a ver unas figuras que se apresuraban, y un momento después la voz de Holmes desde el interior asegurando que era una falsa alarma. Deslizándome entre la multitud que gritaba, me dirigí a la esquina de la calle, y en diez minutos me alegré de encontrar el brazo de mi amigo entre los míos, y de alejarme de la escena del alboroto. Caminó con rapidez y en silencio durante algunos minutos hasta que doblamos por una de las tranquilas calles que conducen a Edgeware Road.

es_results_raw: <output>Gruesas nubes de humo se extendieron por la habitación, cubriendo todo con una capa de oscuridad. La multitud, al principio asustada, pronto se convirtió en un grupo de personas que gritaban y se movían en todas direcciones. Algunos intentaban escapar por la ventana, mientras que otros se dirigían hacia la puerta, tratando de encontrar una salida. Holmes, sin embargo, permaneció sentado en el sofá, observando la escena con una expresión de concentración. Su mano seguía levantada, como si estuviera controlando la situación. La criada, que había abierto la ventana, ahora se encontraba en el pasillo, gritando a los demás para que se apresuraran a salir. El humo se estaba extendiendo rápidamente, y la habitación estaba a punto de ser invadida por la oscuridad. La multitud, cada vez más agitada, se dirigía hacia la puerta, pero Holmes seguía sentado en el sofá, inmóvil y silencioso. Su expresión era impenetrable, pero su ojo derecho parecía estar rastreando algo en la habitación. De repente, se levantó del sofá y se dirigió hacia la puerta, con una determinación en su rostro. La multitud se apartó para dejarlo pasar, y él desapareció en la oscuridad del pasillo. La habitación quedó vacía, excepto por la criada, que seguía gritando a los demás para que se apresuraran a salir. Según me ha explicado, su jefe le ha encargado que averigüe la cantidad de dinero que se gasta en un año en la compra de materiales para la producción de una determinada cantidad de productos, sabiendo que cada producto requiere una cierta cantidad de materiales y que se producen un número determinado de unidades por año. Sin embargo, la complicación surge cuando se da el caso de que algunos materiales se compran a un precio fijo, mientras que otros se compran a un precio variable que depende del mercado. Por lo tanto, la señorita Sutherland necesita encontrar una forma de calcular el costo total de los materiales para la producción de los productos, teniendo en cuenta tanto los costos fijos como los variables. Esto la lleva a preguntar si hay alguna fórmula o método que pueda ayudarle a resolver este problema, y es ahí donde entra en juego la teoría de la programación lineal, que puede ser utilizada para resolver problemas de optimización en situaciones como esta.

en_results_raw: explained to him the situation, hoping that he might be able to shed some light on the matter. He listened attentively, his brow furrowed in concern, and then he asked me to follow him to his office. As we walked, he explained that he had been noticing some strange occurrences in the building lately, with people coming and going at all hours of the night, and that he had been considering installing security cameras to deter any potential intruders. When we arrived at his office, he sat down behind his desk and began to rummage through some papers, muttering to himself about "the Smith case" and "the mysterious letter." I was starting to feel a sense of unease, wondering what was going on in our normally quiet building. The landlord's expression turned grave as he looked up at me and said, "I think we have a bigger problem on our hands than we initially thought." He paused, collecting his thoughts before continuing, "It seems that the letter you received is not an isolated incident. There have been several others like it, all with the same cryptic message and no indication of who sent them or why. The police have been stumped, and I'm starting to wonder if we have a prankster on our hands or something more sinister at play." I felt a chill run down my spine as I realized that this was more than just a simple mystery, it was a full-blown enigma that needed to be solved. The landlord's words hung in the air, leaving me with more questions than answers, and a sense of determination to get to the bottom of it all.

El taxista, un hombre de edad avanzada con un bigote gris, miró en el espejo retrovisor y preguntó con una sonrisa cansada: "¿Señor Holmes, ¿qué le preocupa? ¿Puede que necesite ayuda con algo?". Sherlock Holmes se encogió de hombros y respondió con una voz distraída, "Solo estoy pensando en un caso que no resolví hace unos años, un caso de un ladrón que robaba en la alta sociedad de Londres. Me preocupa que haya escapado y pueda volver a cometer sus fechorías". El taxista asintió con la cabeza y dijo: "Sí, sí, conozco ese caso. Mi hermano fue uno de sus víctimas. Fue un momento muy difícil para nuestra familia". Sherlock Holmes se sentó más derecho y se volvió hacia el taxista, "¿Sí? ¿Qué pasó exactamente? ¿Cómo lo robó el ladrón?" El taxista se detuvo en un semáforo y miró hacia adelante, "Bueno, fue un ladrón muy astuto, siempre se escondía en la sombra y nunca dejaba pistas. Pero mi hermano me dijo que el ladrón siempre llevaba un reloj de pulsera con una inscripción en la parte de atrás". Sherlock Holmes se puso de pie y se acercó al taxista, "¿Qué inscripción? ¿Qué decía exactamente?" El taxista se encogió de hombros, "No lo sé, pero mi hermano dijo que era algo sobre la justicia y la venganza". Sherlock Holmes asintió con la cabeza y se sentó de nuevo, "Sí, sí, eso es importante. Me parece que tenemos un caso que resolver". El taxista sonrió y dijo: "Sí, sí, espero que lo capturen pronto". El taxi se detuvo en la esquina de la calle Baker Street y Sherlock Holmes pagó la cuenta con una sonrisa en el rostro, "Gracias por la información, amigo mío. Ahora, si me disculpa, tengo que ir a trabajar". El taxista asintió con la cabeza y se despidieron con una sonrisa. Sherlock Holmes salió del taxi y se dirigió hacia su consultorio, listo para enfrentar el nuevo caso.

Comenzó a pensar en todas las posibles causas de su tristeza, pero ninguna parecía tener sentido. El silencio entre ellos se prolongó durante varios minutos, hasta que finalmente el hombre habló en voz baja, rompiendo el silencio que había reinado en la habitación. "¿Qué hay que hacer?", preguntó, sin mirar a Holmes. "¿Qué hay que hacer para salir de esta situación?", agregó, con una nota de desesperanza en su voz. Holmes se acercó un poco más a él, intentando mostrarle comprensión y empatía. "No lo sé", respondió, "pero juntos podemos encontrar la forma de salir de esto". La hija era de buena disposición, afable, pero cariñosa y afectuosa a su manera, de modo que era evidente que con sus buenas ventajas personales y sus escasos ingresos, no se le permitiría permanecer soltera por mucho tiempo. Ahora bien, su matrimonio significaría, por supuesto, la pérdida de cien dólares al año, así que ¿qué hace su padrastro para evitarlo? Toma la medida obvia de mantenerla en casa y prohibirle

Me pregunto si he tenido la oportunidad de hacer algo más con mi vida, si he desperdiciado mi tiempo y mis recursos. Me siento vacío y sin propósito, como si no hubiera nada más que hacer que esperar a que llegue mi final. Pero también siento una profunda gratitud por la vida que he tenido, por la familia que tengo, por los amigos que me han acompañado en este viaje. Me pregunto si habrá alguien que pueda ayudarme a encontrar un poco de paz en estos momentos difíciles.

The silence was a palpable thing, a heavy blanket that wrapped around the room, muffling the sounds of the outside world, and allowing Holmes to focus on the puzzle at hand. His fingers drummed a staccato beat on the arm of his chair, a subconscious rhythm that betrayed his growing excitement and anticipation, as he pieced together the fragments of the case, and slowly, but surely, began to see the outlines of a solution take shape.

La habitación estaba llena de humo y el olor a carbón impregnaba el aire, pero Holmes no parecía notarlo. Su mente estaba centrada en el caso, intentando conectar los puntos que no encajaban. De repente, su rostro se iluminó con una idea y se levantó de su asiento, comenzando a pasear por la habitación con un ritmo rápido y nervioso. Su ayudante, Watson, lo observaba con interés, sabiendo que cuando Holmes estaba en este estado, era un signo de que estaba cerca de resolver el enigma. "¿Qué es lo que te ha dado, Holmes?" preguntó Watson, intentando mantener el ritmo con su jefe. "No lo sé aún", respondió Holmes, "pero creo que estoy a punto de descubrirlo". Su dedo índice comenzó a golpear la mesa con impaciencia, marcando el ritmo de su pensamiento. "¿Qué es lo que no encaja?", preguntó Watson, intentando ayudarlo a clarificar sus ideas. "El testigo que declaró haber visto a la víctima en el lugar del crimen", respondió Holmes, "su historia no cuadra con los hechos. Hay algo que no está claro, algo que no encaja". Su mente estaba trabajando a toda velocidad, intentando encontrar la pieza que faltaba para completar el rompecabezas. Y de repente, como por arte de magia, la pieza se colocó en su lugar y la verdad se reveló ante él.

en_first_half: “Away we went then, and we drove for at least an hour. Colonel Lysander Stark had said that it was only seven miles, but I should think, from the rate that we seemed to go, and from the time that we took, that it must have been nearer twelve. He sat at my side in silence all the time, and I was aware, more than once when I glanced in his direction, that he was looking at me with great intensity. The country roads seem to be not very good in that part of the world, for we lurched and jolted terribly. I tried to look out of the windows to see something of where we were, but they were made of frosted glass, and I could make out nothing save the occasional bright blur
en_second_half: of a passing light. Now and then I hazarded some remark to break the monotony of the journey, but the colonel answered only in monosyllables, and the conversation soon flagged. At last, however, the bumping of the road was exchanged for the crisp smoothness of a gravel-drive, and the carriage came to a stand. Colonel Lysander Stark sprang out, and, as I followed after him, pulled me swiftly into a porch which gaped in front of us. We stepped, as it were, right out of the carriage and into the hall, so that I failed to catch the most fleeting glance of the front of the house. The instant that I had crossed the threshold the door slammed heavily behind us, and I heard faintly the rattle of the wheels as the carriage drove away.

es_first_half: "Nos fuimos entonces, y condujimos durante al menos una hora. El coronel Lysander Stark había dicho que sólo eran siete millas, pero yo creía, por la velocidad a la que parecíamos ir, y por el tiempo que tardamos, que debían ser más de doce. Se sentó a mi lado en silencio todo el tiempo, y me di cuenta, más de una vez cuando miré en su dirección, que me estaba mirando con gran intensidad. Parece que las carreteras rurales no son muy buenas en esa parte del mundo, porque dimos unos bandazos y sacudidas terribles. Intenté mirar por las ventanillas para ver algo de dónde estábamos, pero eran de vidrio esmerilado, y no pude distinguir nada más que el borrón ocasional de una luz que pasaba. De vez en
es_second_half: cuando me arriesgaba a hacer algún comentario para romper la monotonía del viaje, pero el coronel sólo respondía con monosílabos, y la conversación pronto decaía. Por fin, sin embargo, los golpes de la carretera fueron sustituidos por la crujiente suavidad de un camino de grava, y el carruaje se detuvo. El coronel Lysander Stark se bajó de él y, mientras yo lo seguía, me arrastró a un porche que se abría ante nosotros. Bajamos, por así decirlo, del carruaje y entramos en el vestíbulo, de modo que no pude echar la más fugaz mirada a la fachada de la casa. En el instante en que crucé el umbral, la puerta se cerró de golpe detrás de nosotros, y oí débilmente el traqueteo de las ruedas mientras el carruaje se alejaba."

en_first_half: “It was pitch dark inside the house, and the colonel fumbled about looking for matches and muttering under his breath. Suddenly a door opened at the other end of the passage, and a long, golden bar of light shot out in our direction. It grew broader, and a woman appeared with a lamp in her hand, which she held above her head, pushing her face forward and peering at us. I could see that she was pretty, and from the gloss with which the light shone
en_second_half: upon her dark dress I knew that it was a rich material. She spoke a few words in a foreign tongue in a tone as though asking a question, and when my companion answered in a gruff monosyllable she gave such a start that the lamp nearly fell from her hand. Colonel Stark went up to her, whispered something in her ear, and then, pushing her back into the room from whence she had come, he walked towards me again with the lamp in his hand.

en_results: The main hall, where the rest of the group was waiting for us. As we walked in, I couldn't
en_results_raw: The main hall, where the rest of the group was waiting for us. As we walked in, I couldn't help but notice the eerie silence that filled the room, punctuated only by the soft hum of the fluorescent lights above. The others seemed just as uneasy as I was, their faces tense and their eyes darting back and forth, searching for any sign of what was to come. Our guide, a stern-looking man with a clipboard, cleared his throat and began to speak in a low, measured tone, his words dripping with an air of authority. "Welcome, everyone, to the heart of the facility. I'm afraid we have a bit of a situation on our hands, and I'll need to brief you all on the details before we proceed further." He paused, surveying the room with a critical eye, before continuing, "As you're all aware, we've been experiencing some... anomalies in the area. Equipment malfunctioning, strange noises, and unexplained occurrences. We've tried to investigate, but so far, we've found nothing concrete. That is, until now." He paused again, his eyes locking onto something behind me, and I turned to see what had caught his attention. That's when I saw it: a figure, standing in the shadows, watching us with an unblinking gaze.

en_first_half: “It is fortunate, for you will perhaps be able to post me up. I read nothing except the criminal news and the agony column.
en_second_half: The latter is always instructive. But if you have followed recent events so closely you must have read about Lord St. Simon and his wedding?”
en_results: The only thing that brings me any joy is the occasional letter from a friend, but even those are few and far between. I've been living in this
en_results_raw: The only thing that brings me any joy is the occasional letter from a friend, but even those are few and far between. I've been living in this small, dingy flat for what feels like an eternity, with nothing but the sound of the city outside my window to keep me company. The smell of the nearby bakery wafts in through the open window, a faint comfort in an otherwise bleak existence. I've taken to writing my own stories, a way to escape the monotony of my daily routine. But even those have begun to feel like a chore, a reminder of all that I'm missing out on. I wonder if anyone will ever read them, or if they'll be lost forever, like so many of the letters I've written to the agony column.

Mientras caminábamos, me contó historias sobre la historia de la casa y los Rucastle, que habían vivido allí durante generaciones. Me mostró también el estanque, donde había una gran cantidad de peces y una pequeña isla en el centro. Me di cuenta de que el señor Rucastle parecía estar muy contento cuando hablaba sobre su hogar y su familia, pero también noté que había algo en su mirada que me hacía sentir incómodo. Al día siguiente, mientras estaba en mi habitación, escuché ruidos extraños provenientes del piso de arriba. Al principio pensé que era solo el señor Rucastle moviéndose, pero luego me di cuenta de que el ruido parecía provenir de una habitación específica. Me pregunté quién podría estar allí y qué podría estar haciendo. Me sentí un poco intranquilo y decidí investigar un poco más. Fui a la biblioteca y busqué en los libros de historia de la casa, pero no encontré nada que me ayudara a resolver el misterio. Me sentí frustrado y decidí preguntarle al señor Rucastle sobre el ruido. Me acerqué a su despacho y llamé a la puerta. "¿Puedo hablar contigo un momento, señor Rucastle?", le dije. "Por supuesto, ¿qué es lo que deseas saber?", me respondió. "Bueno, anoche escuché ruidos extraños en el piso de arriba y me preguntaba si sabes a quién podría corresponder", le dije. El señor Rucastle se rió y me dijo que probablemente era solo el viento que pasaba por la casa. Pero yo no estaba seguro, y me di cuenta de que el señor Rucastle parecía estar ocultando algo. Me sentí un poco incómodo y decidí cambiar de tema. "¿Qué planes tienes para hoy?", le pregunté. "Bueno, hoy voy a ir a la ciudad para hacer algunas compras", me respondió. "¿Puedo ir contigo?", le pregunté. "No, creo que no es necesario", me dijo. Me sentí un poco decepcionado, pero decidí no insistir. Me di cuenta de que el señor Rucastle parecía estar evitando que yo lo acompañara. Me pregunté por qué. Al día siguiente, mientras estaba en el jardín, vi al señor Rucastle saliendo de la casa con una maleta en la mano. Me pregunté adónde podría estar yendo. Me acerqué a él y le pregunté. tr_results_raw: geçen Bayan Kalfa'nın bana, "Konağın en eski ve en gizemli hikayelerinden biri varmış" demişti. "Bu hikaye, konağın kurucusunun, bir zamanlar buraya bir hayaletin mezarını taşımasıyla başlıyordu. O günden beri, konağın her odasında, her koridorda, her pencerede, hayaletin izleri görülmeye başlanmıştı. Bazıları, hayaletin mezarını taşıyan adamın, aslında bir cin olduğunu, diğerleri ise bir mecnun olduğunu söylüyor. Benim için, bu hikaye, konağın gizemini ve gizemini daha da derinleştirmişti. Konağın her odasına girdiğimde, hayaletin mezarını taşıyan adamın izlerini arıyordum. Bir gün, karanlık bir koridorda, bir pencereden geçerken, bir hayaletin mezarını taşıyan adamın resmini gördüm. O anda, karanlık koridorda, bir hayaletin mezarını taşıyan adamın sesini duydum. "Korkarım şimdi anlatacaklarımın ilgisiz olduğunu düşüneceksiniz..."
